SEARCH
Module org.klojang.db
Package org.klojang.jdbc

Class Row

java.lang.Object
org.klojang.jdbc.Row
public class Row extends Object
A thin wrapper around a Map<String,Object> instance mimicking some of the behaviour of the ResultSet class. Row objects are produced by a ResultSetMappifier and can be quickly pushed up into the higher layers of your application and then inserted into a Klojang template.

Note that it is not a primary goal of the Row class to behave exactly like to the ResultSet class. Unlike a ResultSet you can update the values of the Row. As with the ResultSet you can access column values both by column name and by column number, but, unlike ResultSet class, column numbers need to be specified in a zero-based manner.

Author:
Ayco Holleman

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Row(int columnCount)
    Creates a new Row with enough capacity to contain the specified number of "columns" (i.e. map keys).

    Creates a new Row from the data in the specified map.
    Row(Map<String,Object> map, int extraCapacity)
    Creates a new Row from the data in the specified map.

  • Constructor Details

    • Row

      public Row(Map<String,Object> data)
      Creates a new Row from the data in the specified map.
      Parameters:
      data - The data for the Row.

    • Row

      public Row(Map<String,Object> map, int extraCapacity)
      Creates a new Row from the data in the specified map. The specified extra capacity is reserved for the addition of new "columns" (i.e. map keys). Null keys are not allowed.
      Parameters:
      map - The data for the Row.

    • Row

      public Row(int columnCount)
      Creates a new Row with enough capacity to contain the specified number of "columns" (i.e. map keys).
      Parameters:
      columnCount -

    • getEnum

      public <T extends Enum<T>> T getEnum(int colNum, Function<Object,T> parser, Enum<T> nullValue)
      Returns the value of the specified column as an enum using the specified function to parse the value into an enum constant, or nullValue if the value was null.
      Parameters:
      colNum - The column number (zero-based)
      Returns:
      A Boolean representation of the value

      value - The new value

      colName - The name of the new column
      value - The value of the new column

      Parameters:
      colName - The name of the column to update or append
      value - The new value
